header.name: boost/histogram.hpp
header.para: Includes all standard headers of the Boost.histogram library.

The library consists of two histogram implementations, a static and a dynamic one. If you need to configure histograms at runtime, choose the dynamic one, otherwise use the static one. The static one is faster, and a little more convenient, since some errors can be caught at compile time and you don't need to worry about type conversions.

You can freely mix the implementations in your code, they are convertible into each other, and there is a common interface for both. To the extend of what is technically possible, the library has been designed to allow you to write code that is agnostic of the implementation variant.

method.name: bins
method.purpose: Returns the number of bins, excluding overflow/underflow.

method.name: shape
method.purpose: Returns the number of bins, including overflow/underflow.

method.name: uoflow
method.purpose: Returns whether axis has extra overflow and underflow bins.

method.name: label
method.purpose: Returns the axis label, which is a name or description.

method.name: label
method.purpose: Change the label of an axis.

method.name: bins
method.purpose: Returns the number of bins, excluding overflow/underflow.

method.name: shape
method.purpose: Returns the number of bins, including overflow/underflow.

method.name: uoflow
method.purpose: Returns whether axis has extra overflow and underflow bins.

method.name: label
method.purpose: Returns the axis label, which is a name or description.

method.name: label
method.purpose: Change the label of an axis.

class.name: axis_iterator
class.inherit: iterator_facade< axis_iterator< Axis >, const axis_bin< Axis::value_type >, random_access_traversal_tag >

description.para: The axis stores the category labels, and expects that they are addressed using an integer from 0 to n-1. There are no underflow/overflow bins for this axis. Binning is a O(1) operation.

method.name: index
method.purpose: Returns the bin index for the passed argument.

method.name: operator[]
method.purpose: Returns the category for the bin index.

constructor.purpose: Construct from a list of strings.

description.para: The axis is circular and wraps around reaching the perimeter value. Therefore, there are no overflow/underflow bins for this axis. Binning is a O(1) operation.

method.name: index
method.purpose: Returns the bin index for the passed argument.

method.name: operator[]
method.purpose: Returns the starting edge of the bin.

description.para: range after which value wraps around.

constructor.purpose: Constructor for n bins with an optional offset.

class.name: integer_axis
class.purpose: An axis for a contiguous range of integers.

description.para: Binning is a O(1) operation. This axis operates faster than a regular_axis.

method.name: index
method.purpose: Returns the bin index for the passed argument.

method.name: operator[]
method.purpose: Returns the integer that is mapped to the bin index.

description.para: smallest integer of the covered range.
largest integer of the covered range.

constructor.purpose: Construct axis over integer range [min, max].

class.name: regular_axis
class.purpose: Axis for binning real-valued data into equidistant bins.

description.para: The simplest and common binning strategy. Very fast. Binning is a O(1) operation.

method.name: index
method.purpose: Returns the bin index for the passed argument.

method.name: operator[]
method.purpose: Returns the starting edge of the bin.

constructor.purpose: Construct axis with n bins over range [min, max).

class.name: variable_axis
class.purpose: An axis for real-valued data and bins of varying width.

description.para: Binning is a O(log(N)) operation. If speed matters and the problem domain allows it, prefer a regular_axis.

method.name: index
method.purpose: Returns the bin index for the passed argument.

method.name: operator[]
method.purpose: Returns the starting edge of the bin.

constructor.purpose: Construct an axis from bin edges.

typedef.name: axis_bin
typedef.type: typename std::conditional< std::is_floating_point< Value >::value, real_bin< Value >, bin< Value > >::type

typedef.name: builtin_axes
typedef.type: mpl::vector< regular_axis< double >, regular_axis< float >, circular_axis< double >, circular_axis< float >, variable_axis< double >, variable_axis< float >, integer_axis, category_axis >::type

method.name: dim
method.purpose: Number of axes (dimensions) of histogram.

method.name: size
method.purpose: Total number of bins in the histogram (including underflow/overflow)

method.name: sum
method.purpose: Sum of all counts in the histogram.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Reset bin counters to zero.

method.name: axis
method.purpose: Return axis i.

method.name: for_each_axis
method.purpose: Apply unary functor/function to each axis.

method.name: dim
method.purpose: Number of axes (dimensions) of histogram.

method.name: size
method.purpose: Total number of bins in the histogram (including underflow/overflow)

method.name: sum
method.purpose: Sum of all counts in the histogram.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Reset bin counters to zero.

method.name: axis
method.type: constexpr std::add_const< typename fusion::result_of::value_at_c< axes_type, N >::type >::type &
method.purpose: Get N-th axis.

method.name: for_each_axis
method.purpose: Apply unary functor/function to each axis.

function.name: make_static_histogram_with
function.purpose: static type factory with variable storage type

header.name: boost/histogram/serialization.hpp
header.para: Defines the serialization functions, to use with boost.serialize.
